paper_abstract: We provide a stronger definition of anonymity in the context of shared symmetric key primitives, and show that existing schemes do not provide this level of anonymity. A new scheme is presented to share symmetric key operations amongst a set of participants according to a (t, n)-threshold access structure. We quantify the amount of information the output of the shared operation provides about the group of participants which collaborated to produce it.
paper_title: Anonymity in shared symmetric key primitives
